author: Marcus DiNitto (mdinitto@sportingnews.com)
title: ​Dale Earnhardt Jr. welled up watching NASCAR video of him and his dad

Of course, the footage of him and his dad got to Dale Jr., too. Less than a half hour after NASCAR posted the video, he responded with this tweet: Made my eyeballs sweat đŚ https://t.co/VUW02DSPox â Dale Earnhardt Jr. (@DaleJr) February 25, 2017 
The older Earnhardt died in a crash on the final lap of the 2001 Daytona 500. Sixteen years later, Earnhardt Jr. is set to start Sunday in the front row for the 2017 version of the race, which marks his return to the Cup circuit after missing the last 18 races of the 2016Â season while recovering from a concussion.
